intro: Byttneria irwinii, commonly known as the African wild rubber tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a latex-like substance, which has been studied for potential industrial applications. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its unique properties and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
